page.title: 09The Bakers Arms, Bayford.
page.content: Originally this brick built building was a farmhouse and stables. As a result there used to be an archway through the building, that has been filled in and is part of the pub. It has been a public house for over one hundred years. It was originally called{"The Grifon",}but in the early part of this century the village was bought by{Earl Baker,}and the public house was renamed as a result. The facilities include a large public bar and the saloon bar. A games room has now been incorporated in to the public bar. There is a large, popular garden at the rear. This is a{listed building,}it is in a conservation area, and the Green Belt.
